document_data.name: Toadsquat Mountains
document_data.mainbody: The '''Toadsquat Mountains''', or the '''Little Mountains''', formed the northern border of [[Luiren]] in the [[Shining South]] in [[1367 DR]].
document_data.Inhabitants: This mountain range was infested with [[ogres]]. Attracted by the mountain's rich silver deposits, [[dwarves]] helped clear some of the ogre tribes in the east to gain access to mines.{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks archive|54-55}}{{Cite web/Elminster Speaks/Part 46: Doings in Delzimmer, Part 5}} [[Rage drake]]s were also commonly found as far south as the Toadsquats. [[Criosphinx]]es were also sometimes encountered in the region.
document_data.Post Spellplague: The Toadsquat Mountains were slumped alongside the [[Beastlands]]' southern shore. Among their secrets, the fortress of [[Castle Al'hanar]],<ref> which resided on the west bank of [[Blood Lake]].
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
The magical [[greatsword]] ''[[Chalsembyr's Heart]]'' was lost somewhere in the Toadsquat Mountains when its owner [[Bertold|Bertold the Seeker]], a [[paladin]] of [[Torm]], and his party were ambushed by ogres.

It was rumored that a large cache of [[magic]] was buried or stored deep beneath the western Toadsquats, particularly beneath the peaks known as Klauntra's Leap, the Wyrmlar, and Liontlefang. An [[alchemist]] from [[Klionna]], living in [[Delzimmer]] ''circa'' the [[1372 DR|Year of Wild Magic, 1372 DR]], named [[Urngath Dorrund]] apparently believed this rumor enough to pay mercenaries to round up goblins from the area, thinking their blood had magical properties because they drank from mountain springs that welled up through this store of magic.
